TITLE: Pfizer is betting big on cancer drugs to turn business around after Covid decline – here's what to know
SUMMARY: The pharmaceutical giant has been trying to shore up investor sentiment after its shares fell more than 40% in 2023.

TITLE: Novo Nordisk's Wegovy wins FDA approval for cutting heart disease risks, in move that could expand insurance coverage
SUMMARY: That decision could widen insurance coverage for the drug and similar treatments for obesity, which has been a major barrier to access for patients.

TITLE: Eli Lilly says FDA delays approval of Alzheimer's drug in surprise move
SUMMARY: The FDA plans to call a last-minute meeting of its outside advisors to further review the Eli Lilly Alzheimer's treatment's safety and efficacy.

TITLE: Novo Nordisk CEO says experimental weight loss pill could become a best-in-class drug
SUMMARY: Lars Fruergaard Jørgensen's remarks came one day after Novo Nordisk impressed investors with early-stage trial data on amycretin.

TITLE: Spacecraft maker Terran Orbital 'looking at everything,' CEO says after Lockheed Martin takeover bid
SUMMARY: Satellite manufacturer Terran Orbital is "looking at everything" regarding the company's future, CEO Marc Bell told CNBC.

TITLE: GM cuts Chevy Blazer EV price as sales restart following software issues
SUMMARY: GM is reducing the price of its new Chevy Blazer EV as it restarts sales of the vehicle following an 11-week stoppage to address significant software issues.

TITLE: Family offices have tripled since 2019, creating a new gold rush on Wall Street
SUMMARY: Experts say family offices now manage $6 trillion or more, and their ranks are growing.

TITLE: Gap shares pop as company's holiday earnings blow past estimates, Old Navy returns to growth
SUMMARY: Sales at Gap's largest banner Old Navy have been down for more than a year but that trend reversed on Thursday when the retailer reported a 6% jump in revenue.

TITLE: Costco misses holiday-quarter revenue expectations despite online growth
SUMMARY: E-commerce sales grew 18.4% in the quarter compared with the year earlier.

TITLE: Space company Astra going private to avoid bankruptcy after dismal public run
SUMMARY: Space company Astra will go private in a cut-rate deal with its founders after a dismal run as a publicly-traded stock.

TITLE: Grocers are trying to get orders to your door faster than ever — here's why
SUMMARY: Walmart, Target and Kroger are trying to stand out on grocery convenience, not just price.

TITLE: Rivian shares surge as company reveals new EV models, $2.25 billion in cost savings
SUMMARY: The announcements come at a crucial time for Rivian as it attempts to expand its customer base amid slower-than-expected EV sales in the U.S.

TITLE: United to pause pilot hiring, citing Boeing's delivery delays
SUMMARY: United said it will pause pilot hiring in May and June because of delivery delays from Boeing.

TITLE: Barbie is the blueprint as Mattel seeks to revitalize American Girl, Fisher-Price
SUMMARY: Mattel is facing activist pressure from Barington Capital, particularly around its strategy with the Fisher-Price and American Girl brands.

TITLE: NYCB says it lost 7% of deposits in the past month, slashes dividend to 1 cent
SUMMARY: NYCB had $77.2 billion in deposits as of March 5, NYCB said in an investor presentation tied to the capital raise, down from $83 billion it had as of Feb. 5.

TITLE: Cigna will cap how much insurance can spend on weight loss drugs as it tries to expand coverage
SUMMARY: Cigna's Evernorth will limit spending increases for those GLP-1s to a maximum of 15% annually.

TITLE: American Eagle unveils strategy to grow profits, takes $94 million in impairment charges for logistics business
SUMMARY: American Eagle unveiled a new strategy to boost profitable growth over the next three years by focusing on building out its brands and optimizing operations.

TITLE: Robinhood partners with Klutch Sports, brings Rich Paul on as advisor as it moves into sports and entertainment
SUMMARY: Trading platform Robinhood is partnering with Klutch Sports Group, the firm founded by LeBron James' agent Rich Paul, and bring Paul on as an advisor.

TITLE: United Airlines launches Morocco, Colombia flights, beefs up China service
SUMMARY: Major airlines are chasing a rebound in international travel, whose revenue has grown faster than domestic travel.

TITLE: Why private equity has been involved in every recent bank deal
SUMMARY: New York Community Bank's $1 billion-plus capital raise is the latest example of private equity players coming to rescue a regional bank.

TITLE: Biden says Medicare should negotiate prices for at least 50 drugs each year, up from a target of 20
SUMMARY: The proposal is one of several new health-care policy proposals that Biden will outline during his State of the Union address Thursday.

TITLE: Foot Locker shares plunge nearly 30% as retailer posts holiday loss, delays key financial target
SUMMARY: Foot Locker reported earnings as CEO Mary Dillon leads the legacy retailer through an ambitious turnaround. But some analysts say it has gone too slowly.

TITLE: Abercrombie & Fitch beats holiday estimates as sales soar again, helped by higher prices
SUMMARY: Abercrombie & Fitch has been on a rollercoaster of growth over the last year and Wall Street will be keen to see if it can sustain the momentum.

TITLE: Russian oligarch's yacht is costing U.S. taxpayers close to $1 million a month
SUMMARY: The Justice Department is seeking permission to sell a 348-foot yacht called Amadea, which it seized in 2022, alleging it was owned by Suleiman Kerimov.

TITLE: Target launches paid membership program as it chases new revenue streams
SUMMARY: Target is following the playbook of Amazon and Walmart, which already have similar programs.

TITLE: Target shares pop more than 12% as retailer boosts profits, despite lackluster sales forecast
SUMMARY: Target grew profits even as sales stagnated, and said it plans to launch a new membership program.

TITLE: Dodge Charger will live on as a new EV and a gas-powered muscle car
SUMMARY: Dodge on Tuesday revealed the new Charger as an all-electric vehicle as well as a next-generation gas-powered muscle car.

TITLE: New CFPB rule caps banks' credit card late fees at $8
SUMMARY: By cutting late fees to $8 from an average of around $32, more than 45 million card users would save an average of $220 annually, the CFPB said in a release.

TITLE: Nordstrom shares fall 10% as retailer warns of potential sales declines in 2024
SUMMARY: The department store retailer said revenue for the year ahead will range from a 2% decline to a 1% gain compared with the previous year.

TITLE: Novo Nordisk's diabetes drug Ozempic slashed the risk of kidney disease progression in trial
SUMMARY: The results add to the growing evidence that the highly popular injection has broader health benefits for patients beyond treating Type 2 diabetes.
